course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Carbon Footprint Analysis and Reduction
course.description: This course aims to provide students with an understanding of the sources and impacts of climate change, national and international policies, Kyoto Protocol, carbon credits and offset concepts. As engineers to be, students will also be able to calculate organization's carbon footprint, identify suitable mitigation strategies and provide carbon reduction solutions.
course.prerequisites: CIVL 2410 OR ENVR 3210

reviews.author: ljdjlalb
reviews.title: Review on 4450
reviews.comment_content:
Contents are well prepared in regards to the carbon management.

However, it is not interesting to me. The carbon management is literally so distinct from my major (civil engineering). So, if you are trying to take courses about calculation, model formulation, it would not be the best choice. But, if you are trying to fulfil the free elective requirement with minimal effort, it would the best choice.
reviews.comment_teaching: Shelleyâ€™s teaching is direct, and easy to understand. She is also a very nice professor and passionate about teaching
reviews.comment_workload:
1 assignment + 1 exam + 1 project
Regarding the exam, try to recite all the lectures (or least what Shelley does not skip on class). You are then very good for the exam.
For the project, it is very light as well. 2000 words write-up equally divided into 6 six in a group.

reviews.author: shirayuki653
reviews.comment_content:
Module 1:Climate Change Basics
Module 2:Carbon Footprint Measurement
Module 3: Carbon Management Concepts(carbon trading and offset)
Module 4: Carbon Reduction Solutions

The course introduces the basic concepts in carbon management. With the latest trend to cope with climate change, the content if self is quite practical and also up-to date. Students are expected to get some insights to field of environmental sustainability.

As a CIVL-4000 level course, the content is a bit little as the content is less engineering orientated but more on the managing aspect. All the calculations are from module 2, and they should be easy to handle for civil students. They are just unit conversions.

For CIEV students, one of the electives should be chosen from this course or the other two taught by Prof. Lo( CIVL5450 and CIVL5460) . Besides, some EVMT, CEEV and SUSEE students will take this course, not sure this is a must for them or not.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Zhou delivers the concepts clearly. Her teaching will introduce some of her working experience, but most of them are extra. You just need to read all the slides so that you can catch up the course well, since the PowerPoint slides are good enough to digest.

Moreover, the TA is in charge of all the course logistics.He will prepare the assignments and also the mid-term
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20% (I think below mean since I make some silly mistakes)
Mid-term exam 50%:Remember to revise and memorize as many  slides as you can!(asked TA for grades, My score=69.5, mean=67)
Project 30%(Paper 20%+Presentation 10%):Professor give good comments on our team's work

Grade:A-, may be half A range and B range for other half. Comparatively, the grading is lenient if you are a year 3 civil student.(At least better than 3310 and 3510)
reviews.comment_workload: The most workload is to attend lessons at night(7-10 pm),but the good thing is that there is only one lecture every week.The assignment can be done within 2 hours

reviews.author: maanki poon
reviews.comment_content: The content is useful that it is related to the actual business environment.  It cover carbon audit and carbon reduction solutions in buildings.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course instructor teaches very useful content and combines the learning material with her actual working experience. The professor is very willing to offer help and she is very kind to students. She speaks good english and her Powerpoint slides are easy to read.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is reasonable. Largely depends on the final exam result and the presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is reasonable. Selecting suitable teammates is very important.

reviews.author: BillyTsang
reviews.title: Carbon
reviews.comment_content:
Climate change is becoming the latest hot topic in environmental science and engineering. Topics of this course is within the area of sustainable development in environmental engineering.

Module 1: Climate change basics
1.1 Greenhouse effect and greenhouse gases
1.2 Anthropogenic evidences
1.3 Climate change consequences
1.4 The climate change convention
1.5 Carbon footprint concept
Module 2: Carbon footprint measurement
2.1 Corporate carbon audit
2.2 Setting boundaries
2.3 Quantifying emission
2.4 Baseline and base year
2.5 Reporting tools
2.6 Product carbon footprint
Module 3: Carbon management
3.1 Management concepts
3.2 Carbon trading and offsetting
3.3 Carbon neutrality and case study
Module 4: Carbon reduction solutions
4.1 Green building labeling scheme
4.2 Low carbon building solutions
4.3 Waste management
4.4 Low carbon transportation
reviews.comment_teaching: Her powerpoint slides are plain black and white. All the content are in her slides so during the lecture she just read the slides out with some explanatory elaboration. Final exam is the game of memorizing powerpoint slides.
reviews.comment_workload: The single piece of assignment is just a summation of all calculations as illustrated in module 2. The word limit on project paper is at most 2000 words. The project takes one to two days to finish. The presentation (at most 10 minutes) is just a read-aloud version of the project.

reviews.author: Shania
reviews.comment_content: Content wise, it was quite simple. Not too many complicated or difficult concepts to grasp. Few calculation questions, but not that complicated either.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching style was alright because it was a small class. The instructor was very knowledgeable in this field and could answer all the questions clearly. She used a powerpoint presentation, and they made good notes, but also elaborated herself.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Only 1 big assignment, done individually, and 1 big final project done in groups of 2-4. There was a final exam but that was done before exam period.

reviews.author: hugochiu
reviews.title: Well fair course for Year 4 grade chaser
reviews.comment_content:
Module 1:Climate Change Basics
Module 2:Carbon Footprint Measurement
Module 3: Carbon Management Concepts(carbon trading and offset)
Module 4: Carbon Reduction Solutions

I am exam oriented, so just be aware to the sub title, especially for the options or the definition stuff. For the project, this year is a carbon reduction report to Gammon.
Quite an amount student from ENVR, which are girls. It would be a nice opportunity for you to expand your social sphere to girl through the project.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor  Zhou is quite free style, who is able to speak Cantonese. Tbt I am an exam oriented guy, just pay attention a bit to those content she said would include in the exam. The content would not be useful for your future path if you are aiming the civil field.

TA? Didn't meet him/her ever. No contact.
reviews.comment_grading:
No midterm. Just a project with Gammon and a final exam. Attendance marks would be full for all the people. But the content is so easy. Our project is taken so seriously that most people are wear in full suit.

Grade:A-, just fair tbt. As the final is quite easy and the project we have done is quite encouraging. But lastly just score an A-. It depends on what you aim tbt.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload tbt. The content is not that difficult to understand. Or even no concept is needed time for interpretation. (maybe that's y I just score A-). Anyway, those girls are very hardworking that always seeing them copy notes during lesson. It is completely okay for you to take up the course two days before exam.
